mozilla.components.concept.toolbar

Interface Toolbar


  • public Toolbar

    Interface to be implemented by components that provide browser toolbar functionality.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Toolbar.ActionButton
      An action button to be added to the toolbar.
      static class  Toolbar.ActionImage
      An action that just shows a static, non-clickable image.
      static class  Toolbar.ActionSpace
      An "empty" action with a desired width to be used as "placeholder".
      static class  Toolbar.ActionToggleButton
      An action button with two states, selected and unselected. When the button is pressed, the state changes automatically.
      static class  Toolbar.DefaultImpls
      Interface to be implemented by components that provide browser toolbar functionality.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBrowserAction(Toolbar.Action action)
      Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the toolbar in display mode.
      void addNavigationAction(Toolbar.Action action)
      Adds an action to be displayed on the far left side of the URL in display mode.
      void addPageAction(Toolbar.Action action)
      Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the URL in display mode.
      android.view.View asView()
      Casts this toolbar to an Android View object.
      void displayProgress(int progress)
      Displays the given loading progress. Expects values in the range 0,100.
      java.lang.String getUrl()
      Sets/Gets the URL to be displayed on the toolbar.
      boolean onBackPressed()
      Should be called by an activity when the user pressed the back key of the device.
      void setOnUrlCommitListener(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super java.lang.String,kotlin.Unit> listener)
      Registers the given function to be invoked when the user selected a new URL i.e. is done editing.
      void setSearchTerms(java.lang.String searchTerms)
      Displays the currently used search terms as part of this Toolbar.
      void setUrl(java.lang.String p)
      Sets/Gets the URL to be displayed on the toolbar.

      • setSearchTerms

        void setSearchTerms(java.lang.String searchTerms)

        Displays the currently used search terms as part of this Toolbar.

        Parameters:
        searchTerms - the search terms used by the current session

      • displayProgress

        void displayProgress(int progress)

        Displays the given loading progress. Expects values in the range 0,100.

        See Also:
        0,100

      • onBackPressed

        boolean onBackPressed()

        Should be called by an activity when the user pressed the back key of the device.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the back press event was handled and should not be propagated further.

      • setOnUrlCommitListener

        void setOnUrlCommitListener(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super java.lang.String,kotlin.Unit> listener)

        Registers the given function to be invoked when the user selected a new URL i.e. is done editing.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener function

      • addBrowserAction

        void addBrowserAction(Toolbar.Action action)

        Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the toolbar in display mode.

        Related: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/user_interface/Browser_action

      • addPageAction

        void addPageAction(Toolbar.Action action)

        Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the URL in display mode.

        Related: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/user_interface/Page_actions
